CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 23, 1960, pg. 2 reads: " 'Luxurious Rentals,; Non-luxurious Apartments - There are many who believe that there is no place like home, but some tenants, one in particular, in "luxury apartments" at 71 [711] Wandless St., Hill District, are not so sure. The rentals are too high for the poor living conditions of the apartments, they charge.  Upper left photograph, apartment at lower left, with burned-out mattress leaning against the side of the building, rents for "just" $77.50 to $125 a month.  The "Luck" dweller is just 25 to 50 feet away and can dig the view...-Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Alleyway with debris and mattress behind set of apartments with dilapidated second floor porches, 711 Wandless Street, Hill District
